R301.2.4 Floodplain Construction: Amend as follows:
Code requirements applicable to properties located in special flood management areas are regulated under the stormwater and floodplain
regulations of the village zoning ordinance are not within the scope of this code.
R302.3 Two Family Dwellings: Amend as follows:
Dwelling units in two-family dwellings shall be separated from each other by wall and floor assemblies having not less than a 2-hour fire-resistance
rating where tested in accordance with ASTM E 119 or UL 263. Fire-resistance-rated floor/ceiling and wall assemblies shall extend to and be tight
against the exterior wall, and wall assemblies shall extend from the foundation to the underside of the roof sheathing.
Exceptions:
1. A fire-resistance rating of 1-hour shall be permitted in buildings equipped throughout with an automatic sprinkler system installed in
accordance with NFPA 13.
2. Wall assemblies need not extend through attic spaces where the ceiling is protected by not less than 5/8-inch (15.9 mm) type X gypsum
board, an attic draft stop constructed as specified in section R302.12.1 is provided above and along the wall assembly separating the dwellings
and the structural framing supporting the ceiling is protected by not less than 1/2-inch (12.7 mm) gypsum board or equivalent.
R309.1 Floor Surface: Amend as follows:
Garage floor surfaces shall be of approved noncombustible and nonabsorbent material. Garage floors adjacent to a dwelling unit shall be poured a
minimum of 4" below the top of foundation wall and shall be sloped to facilitate the movement of liquids out of the garage and toward the vehicle
entry door. A 4" concrete gas curb poured above the garage floor elevation may be provided if the floor is not depressed below the top of
foundation wall.
R309.3 Flood Hazard Areas: Amend as follows:
Code requirements applicable to properties located in special flood management areas are regulated under the stormwater and floodplain
regulations of the village zoning ordinance are not within the scope of this code.
R309.6 Garage Egress: Add new section as follows:
All detached garages shall be equipped with a side hinged man door allowing direct egress to the exterior of the building. The required door shall
be no less than 32" in width and 80" in height.
R311.5.9 Exterior Stairs: Add section as follows:
All elevated exterior deck or patio structures greater than 50 square feet in area shall be equipped with a code compliant stairway or ramp to
grade. Exterior stairways and ramps shall be constructed in compliance with all requirements of sections R311.5 and 311.6 of this code.
R313 Automatic Fire Sprinkler Systems: Delete section in its entirety.
R320 Accessibility: Delete section in its entirety.
R323 Flood-Resistant Construction: Amend as follows:
Code requirements applicable to properties located in special flood management areas are regulated under the stormwater and floodplain
regulations of the village zoning ordinance are not within the scope of this code.
R326 Swimming Pools, Spas And Hot Tubs: Amend section to read:
The design and construction of pools, spas and hot tubs shall comply with title 4, chapter 7, of the village code and applicable provisions of the
village electrical code and village plumbing code.
R327 Professional Preparation Of Plans: Add new section as follows:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 140/460
All plans submitted with building permit applications to construct new single-family, two-family, or townhouse residential units shall be prepared by
a licensed architect or structural engineer registered in the state of Illinois and shall bear the stamp of his official seal. Plans for building additions
or renovations of non-conventional design, or designed as permitted under the provisions of sections R301.1.1, R301.1.2, or R301.1.3 of this code,
shall be prepared by a licensed architect or structural engineer registered in the state of Illinois.
Chapter 4 Foundations
R401.1 Application: Amend as follows:
The provisions of this chapter shall control the design and construction of the foundation for all buildings. (Delete all reference to wood
foundations.)
R402.1 Wood Foundations: Delete in its entirety.
R402.3 Precast Concrete: Add the following:
Detailed structural plans including field erection specifications must be provided with all permit applications for buildings utilizing precast concrete
components. The required plans must be prepared and certified by a licensed structural engineer registered in the state of Illinois.
R403.1.1 Minimum Size: Amend as follows:
Concrete footings shall be provided and sized so as to support and distribute all imposed loads based upon the load-bearing value of the soil but
not less than 8" thick x 16" wide when supporting an 8" thick wall, and 10" thick x 20" wide when supporting a 10" thick wall.
R403.1.4.1 Frost Protection: Amend as follows:
With exception of single-story freestanding accessory structures not to exceed 600 square feet in area, all foundation walls, piers, and other
permanent supports of buildings and structures shall be protected from frost by constructing the foundation support a minimum of 42" below the
proposed final grade level. Footings shall not bear on frozen soil.
R403.2 Footings For Wood Foundations: Delete in its entirety.
R403.3 Frost Protected Shallow Foundations: Delete in its entirety.
R404.1.5.3 Pier And Curtain Wall Foundations: Delete in its entirety.
R404.2 Wood Foundation Walls: Delete in its entirety.
R404.6 Concrete Pier Foundations: Add section as follows:
Concrete pier foundation systems may be used to support exterior decks, screen rooms and similar accessory type structures only. Piers must be
sized to support and distribute the imposed load but shall be no less than 10" in diameter.
R404.7 Trench Foundations: Add section as follows:
Poured concrete trench foundations may be used to support single story frame additions to existing structures not to exceed 350 square feet in
area. Trench foundations must be designed and constructed to support and distribute the imposed loads and shall have foundation walls not less
than 8" thick "belled" at the base to no less than 16" in width.
R404.8 Slab On Grade Foundations: Add section as follows:
Monolithic slab on grade foundations may be used to support single-story non-habitable accessory buildings not to exceed 600 square feet in area.
Slab foundations shall be designed and constructed to support and distribute the imposed loads and shall be no less than 12" wide x 18" thick with
2-#5 bars around the entire perimeter. The slab shall be poured monolithically with the footing and shall be no less than 4" thick reinforced with 6 x
6 welded wire fabric supported on a minimum 4" compacted stone base.
R405.1 Concrete Or Masonry Foundations: Amend as follows:
Delete exception. Foundation drainage is required with all soil types.
R405.2 Wood Foundations: Delete in its entirety.
R406.3 Dampproofing For Wood Foundations: Delete in its entirety.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 141/460
R408.7 Flood Resistance: Amend as follows:
Code requirements applicable to properties located in special flood management areas are regulated under the stormwater and floodplain
regulations of the village zoning ordinance are not within the scope of this code.
R408.8 Crawl Space Floor: Add new section as follows:
A minimum 2 inch thick concrete slab shall be poured in all crawl space areas. The required slab shall be installed over a minimum of 4 inches of
stone over a 6 mil polyethylene film moisture barrier installed as required by this code.
Chapter 5 Floors
R502.7.1 Bridging: Amend as follows:
All floor joists with a clear span greater than 8' shall be supported laterally at mid span by solid blocking or diagonal bridging.
R504 PPT Wood Floors (On Ground): Delete section in its entirety.
R506.1 General: Amend as follows:
Concrete slab on grade floors shall be a minimum 4" thick. The specified compressive strength of concrete shall be as set forth in section R402.2
of this code.
R506.2.1 Fill: Amend as follows:
Fill material shall be free of vegetation and foreign material. All material shall be compacted in lifts to assure uniform support of the slab. Self
compacting materials such as washed stone or pea gravel shall be used when the depth of fill required exceeds 24 inches. The use of any organic
soils as fill material is prohibited.
R506.2.2 Base: Amend as follows:
Delete exception. A stone base course is required under all concrete slabs.
Chapter 6
R606.1.1 Professional Registration Not Required: Delete section in its entirety.
Chapter 7 Wall Covering
R703.1.3 Wall Sheathing: Add new section as follows:
An approved wall sheathing material shall be provided on the exterior of all frame structures.
Exception: Wall sheathing is not required under wood structural panel siding 9/16" thick or greater when installed on non-habitable detached
accessory structures less than 200 square feet in area.
R703.2 Weather-Resistive Barrier: Amend as follows:
An approved weather resistant sheathing paper free from holes and breaks shall be installed under all exterior wall covering materials.
Exception: Weather resistant sheathing paper is not required on non-habitable detached accessory buildings less than 200 square feet in area.
R703.8.2 Exterior Veneer Support: Amend as follows:
Exterior masonry veneers may not be supported by any wood framing member. Structural support over openings and intersecting roof areas shall
be provided by means of steel lintels independent of any wood framing. All lintels shall be properly supported by steel beams, steel columns, or
load bearing masonry to the foundation below.
Delete subsections: R703.8.2.1 and R703.8.2.2 in their entirety.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 142/460
Chapter 8 Roof-Ceiling Construction
R801.3 Roof Drainage: Amend as follows:
All dwelling units shall be provided with rain gutters and downspouts that will collect and discharge all roof drainage to the ground surface at least
5' from foundation walls or to an approved drainage system. Discharge from rain gutters and sump pumps into yards of less than 10' in width shall
be prohibited.
R802.10.1.1 Raised Heel Roof Trusses: Add section as follows:
All roof trusses installed above conditioned spaces of dwelling units shall be of a raised heel design so as to allow for the full depth of required
ceiling insulation to be installed over the exterior wall plate.

4-14-3: PENALTY:
Any person having been found by a court of competent jurisdiction to have violated or failed to comply with any provision of this chapter or the one- and
two-family dwelling unit code or prior sections hereby amended shall be fined for each violation or such failure in an amount as specified in the annual fee
ordinance. Additional violations or any such failure to comply shall be construed and deemed to be separate and distinct offenses subjecting the violator to
an additional fine for each day of each violation or noncompliance. (Ord. 2006-4054, 9-11-2006, eff. 10-1-2006)

least fifteen (15) days prior to the adoption hereof and are now on file in the office of the village clerk, and have been there kept available for public use,

If the work described in any building permit has not begun within ninety (90) days from the date of issuance thereof, or if the permitted work is
suspended or abandoned for more than forty-five (45) days, said permit shall expire and be canceled by the building official and written notice thereof
shall be given to the persons affected.

described in the canceled permit shall not proceed unless and until a building permit extension has been obtained along with payment of the required

108.5 Stop Work Orders. Amend section to read:
Whenever the building official finds work regulated by this code being performed in a manner either contrary to the provisions of this code or
dangerous or unsafe, the building official is authorized to issue a stop work order. The stop work order shall be in writing and shall be given to the
owner of the property involved, or to the owner's agent, or to the person doing the work. Upon issuance of a stop work order, the cited work shall
immediately cease. The stop work order shall state the reason for the order, and the conditions under which the cited work will be permitted to
resume. Any person who shall continue any work after having been served with a stop work order, except such work as that person is directed to
perform to remove a violation or unsafe condition, shall be subject to penalties as prescribed by law. Each day that a violation continues shall be
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 144/460
deemed a separate offense.
Section 109 Means Of Appeal. Delete section in its entirety and replace with:
109.1 Means Of Appeal Or Variation. Any person shall have the right to appeal a decision of the code official or request a variation from the terms of
this code before the board of appeals. An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of this code or the rules legally adopted
hereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of this code do not fully apply, or an equivalent form of construction is to be used. The
board of appeals shall grant variations from the strict application of any of the requirements of this code in the case of exceptional conditions,
whereby such strict application would result in practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship that would deprive the owner of reasonable use of the land
or building involved. In granting any variation, the board of appeals shall prescribe any conditions that it deems to be necessary or desirable. The
board shall affirm, modify, or reverse the decision of the code official by a majority vote. The board of appeals shall be the village of Lisle president
and board of trustees and the chairman of the board of appeals shall be the president, also known as the mayor, of the village of Lisle.

EXISTING BUILDING CODE
4-16-1: ADOPTION OF EXISTING BUILDING CODE:
There is hereby adopted by the village, for the purpose of establishing rules and regulations for the construction, alteration, removal, demolition, relocation,
equipment use and occupancy, location and maintenance of buildings and structures, including permits and penalties, that certain document, one copy of
which is filed in the office of the village clerk, being marked and designated as the 2015 international existing building code, as published by the
International Code Council, and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said code are hereby referred to, adopted
and made part hereof as if fully set out in this chapter, with the additions, insertions, deletions and changes prescribed in section 4-16-2 of this chapter,
and from the date on which this chapter shall take effect, the provisions thereof shall be controlling within the village. (Ord. 2016-4627, 1-4-2016)
4-16-2: AMENDMENTS:
The existing building code of the village of Lisle, as hereinbefore adopted, is amended in the following respects:
101.1 Title. These regulations shall be known as the Existing Building Code Of The Village Of Lisle, hereinafter referred to as "this code."
101.8 Add new section:
101.8 Existing Work.
All provisions of this code allowing for existing work to remain shall be applicable only to work that was legally constructed using materials that were
permitted for use at the time of construction. These provisions shall not be construed to allow continuation or approval of existing work that did not comply
with the applicable code at the time of construction.
101.9 Add new section:
101.9 Plumbing Code. All references in this code to the international plumbing code shall be replaced with the reference to the latest Illinois plumbing
code.
105.2 Work Exempt From Permit. Amend to read:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 145/460
Exemptions from permit requirements of this code shall not be deemed to grant authorization for any work to be done in any manner in violation of the
provisions of this code or any other laws or ordinances of this jurisdiction. Permits shall not be required for the following:
1. Residential play equipment installed accessory to a group R-3 occupancy and intended for the use of children.
2. Landscape retaining walls not more than 2' in height used to create decorative landscape beds. Retaining walls installed for the purpose of changing the
lot grade level or drainage flow shall be regulated under title 5, chapter 16 and title 7, chapter 2 of the village code.
3. Minor pavement work constructed entirely on private property in conformance with the setback requirements of the village zoning ordinance, not more
than 6" above existing grade, provided said improvements do not obstruct stormwater drainage or create a safety hazard. All new or replacement
pavement work occurring in a village owned public right-of-way shall require a permit under section 7-1-4 of the village code. Village staff shall determine if
work is minor following a cursory review of the project.
4. Painting, papering, tiling, carpeting and similar cosmetic finish work.
5. Portable private residential swimming pools accessory to a group R-3 occupancy, installed entirely above ground, less than 24" in depth, and with a
surface area less than 250 square feet, and less than 3,250 gallons in volume.
6. Minor electrical repair work, including the replacement of lamps or the connection of approved portable electrical equipment to approved permanently
installed receptacles.
7. Replacement of any minor part of existing mechanical equipment that does not alter approval of equipment or make such equipment unsafe.
8. The stopping of plumbing leaks in drains, water, soil, waste or vent pipe, provided, however, that if any concealed trap, drain pipe, water, soil, waste or
vent pipe becomes defective and it becomes necessary to remove and replace the same with new material, such work shall be considered as new work
and a permit shall be obtained and inspection made as provided in the plumbing code.

and consultants.
(b) That any additional documents reasonably required by the building department which are necessary for the review of plans and drawings to determine

and amount as approved by the village. This letter of credit shall be for the purpose of securing construction or removal of the foundation upon the
property, and restoration of the site to its natural condition if a full building permit is not issued.
(f) That the application is approved by the building code board of appeals.
The holder of such permit for the foundation shall proceed at the holder's own risk with the building operation and without assurance that a permit for the
entire structure will be granted. Any permit issued hereunder shall expire 90 days after date of issue or upon issuance of a full building permit, whichever is
first to occur. Extensions to the dates of validity of the permit shall be authorized only by the building code board of appeals.

113.1 Means Of Appeal Or Variation: Any person shall have the right to appeal a decision of the building official or request a variation from the terms of
this code before the board of appeals. An application for appeal shall be based on a claim that the true intent of this code or the rules legally adopted
hereunder have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of this code do not fully apply, or an equivalent form of construction is to be used. The board of
appeals shall grant variations from the strict application of any of the requirements of this code in the case of exceptional conditions, whereby such strict
application would result in practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship that would deprive the owner of reasonable use of the land or building involved. In
granting any variation, the board of appeals shall prescribe any conditions that it deems to be necessary or desirable. The board shall affirm, modify, or
reverse the decision of the building official by a majority vote. The board of appeals shall be the village of Lisle president and board of trustees and the
chairman of the board of appeals shall be the president, also known as the mayor, of the village of Lisle.
113.4 Violation Penalties. Amend section to read:
Any person who violates a provision of this code or fails to comply with any of the requirements thereof or who erects, constructs, alters or repairs a
building or structure in violation of the approved construction documents or directive of the building official, or of a permit or certificate issued under the
provisions of this code, shall be subject to penalties as prescribed by law. Each day that a violation continues shall be deemed a separate offense.
114.3 Unlawful Continuance. Amend to read:
Any person who shall continue any work after having been served with a stop work order, except such work as that person is directed to perform to
remove a violation or unsafe condition, shall be subject to penalties as prescribed by law. Each day that a violation continues shall be deemed a separate
offense.
410 Accessibility For Existing Buildings. Delete section in its entirety.

Exception: The replacement of a code compliant egress window with a new window unit shall not result in the window being made non-compliant with the
minimum dimensional requirements of the code for egress openings.

1. In group A, B, E, F, M, U and S occupancies, a single exit is permitted in the story at the level of exit discharge when the occupant load of the story does
not exceed 20 persons.
806 Accessibility. Delete section in its entirety.

Any building having occupied floors more than 50 feet above the lowest level of fire department vehicle access shall comply with the requirements of
sections 902.1.1 and 902.1.2.

A certificate of occupancy shall be issued where a change of occupancy occurs.
