The actual, final connection fee shall be computed by multiplying the actual average daily flow, based on three hundred sixty (360) days per year in the
first year during which the use is at an occupancy rate of eighty five percent (85%) (base year) by the connection fee in effect at the end of the base year,
for single-family residential dwelling units, and dividing the resulting product by three hundred fifty (350). If the actual fee is more than the estimated fee
previously advanced, the user and/or owner of the building shall immediately pay the difference to the village.
If the estimated connection fee is greater than the actualfee, the village shall return the overpayment to the user and/or owner upon return of the
overpayment from the county. The village shall not be held liable for payment to the user and/or owner until and unless the village receives payment from
the county. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
(D) Additional Fees: All connections of village sewer lines, which lines were constructed by or for the village, excepting those sewer lines constructed
pursuant to the subdivision regulations of the village as on site improvements, shall, in addition to all other connection fees and charges, be subject to a
fee as established by the annual fee ordinance per foot of lot frontage. (Ord. 2002-3395, 4-15-2002)
(E) Additions To Previous Connections: Any and all additions, remodelings, or change of use to buildings, previously connected to the village sanitary
sewer mains shall be treated as new connections for purposes of this section, and connection fees paid in accordance with the provisions of this
section, less any previously paid fees.
(F) Building Permits: The connection fees shall be paid at the time of issuance of applicable building permits and no permit shall be issued without said
fees having been paid. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
(G) Maximum Connection Fee: The maximum current connection fee charged by the county of DuPage, per agreement with the village, is as established
by the annual fee ordinance per residential equivalent. In the event the county shall raise its charges, all such additional charges shall be paid by the
users making connection into the sewer system and not by the village. In case of notice from the county to the village of an increase in county charges,
the user shall, prior to acceptance by the village of said increase, deposit a sum equal to said increase in county charges or deposit with the village an
irrevocable binding letter of credit in a form acceptable to the village and from a financial institution acceptable to the village attorney in said amount.
Said sum or letter of credit shall be released when, if, and to the extent that the county agrees to reduce its increase in charges. (Ord. 2005-3933, 6-20-
2005)
7-6-7: SEWERAGE SYSTEM RATES:
The rates and charges as established by the annual fee ordinance may be from time to time amended, upon approval of the corporate authorities.
The rates or charges are hereby established by the annual fee ordinance for the following use and for the service supplied by the sewerage system of the
village:
Single-family residence.
Multiple-family buildings.
Rooming houses.
All other users.
Users of the village sewerage system located outside the corporate limits of the village shall pay an increased amount as established by the annual fee
ordinance. (Ord. 98-2964, 3-2-1998)
7-6-8: BILLING PROCEDURES:
(A) All Single-Family Users:
1. Charges for service shall be made bimonthly for all single-family users of the village sanitary sewer system. The charges provided for shall be
payable bimonthly on the first day of the month immediately following the end of the bimonthly period for which service has been supplied. The
owner of the premises, the occupant thereof and the user of the service shall be jointly and severally liable to pay for the service on such premises.
2. All bills for service shall be rendered as of the first day of the month following the bimonthly period for which the service is billed, or as soon
thereafter as possible, and shall be payable not later than the close of business on the fifteenth day after the date the bills are rendered. If payment
in full of the bill is not made within said period, then a penalty as established by the annual fee ordinance in relation to the amount of the total
outstanding and unpaid bill shall be added thereto.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 312/460
3. If the charges for services are not paid within thirty (30) days after rendition of the bill for such service, such charges shall be deemed and are
hereby declared to be delinquent, and thereafter such delinquency shall constitute a lien upon the real estate for which such service is supplied, and
the village treasurer is hereby authorized and directed to file sworn statements showing such delinquencies in the office of the county recorder of
deeds and the filing of such statements shall be deemed notice of the lien of such charges for such service.
4. All sewerage services may be discontinued from any premises owned or occupied by any person liable for the payment of the sewer service bill
without further notice if the rates or charges are not paid within thirty (30) days after rendition of the bill thereof. The service shall not be reinstated
until all past due bills, including the penalties thereon, are paid in full, plus an amount as established by the annual fee ordinance to cover the cost of
disconnection of service and reconnection of the same.
5. It is hereby made the duty of the village to render bills for service for all rates and charges in connection therewith and to collect all monies due
thereon. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
(B) All Users Other Than Single-Family:
1. Charges for service shall be made each month of the calendaryear for all users of the village sanitary sewer system other than single-family users.
Charges shall be payable monthly on the first day of the month immediately following the month for which service has been supplied. The owner of
the premises, the occupant thereof and the user of the service shall be jointly and severally liable to pay for the service on such premises. (Ord. 98-
2962, 2-16-1998)
2. All bills for service shall be rendered as of the first day of the month following the month for which service is billed, or as soon thereafter as possible,
and shall be payable not later than the close of business on the fifteenth day after the date the bills are rendered. If payment in full of the bill is not
made within said period, then a penalty as established by the annual fee ordinance in relation to the amount of the total outstanding and unpaid bill
shall be added thereto.
3. If the charges for services are not paid within thirty (30) days after rendition of the bill for such service, such charges shall be deemed and are
hereby declared to be delinquent, and thereafter such delinquency shall constitute a lien upon the real estate for which such service is supplied, and
the village treasurer is hereby authorized and directed to file sworn statements showing such delinquencies in the office of the county recorder of
deeds and the filing of such statements shall be deemed notice of the lien of such charges for such service.
4. All water and/or all sewerage services may be disconnected from any premises owned or occupied by any person liable for the payment of the
sewer service bill, including any premises owned or occupied by the person liable other than the premises against which the delinquency currently
exists, without further notice if the rates or charges are not paid within thirty (30) days after rendition of the bill therefor. The service shall not be
reinstated until all past due bills, including the penalties thereon, are paid in full, plus the amount required by this subsection (B)4 for the cost of
disconnection and reconnection of service. For purposes of this subsection (B)4, the disconnection/reconnection fee for water services shall be as
established by the annual fee ordinance, and the disconnection/reconnection fee for sewerage service shall be as established by the annual fee
ordinance. As soon as practicable after the payment of all past due water and/or sewer bills and charges, the village public works department shall,
during the regular operating hours of the department, take all steps necessary to reconnect the water supply to the subject premises.
5. It is hereby made the duty of the village to render bills for service for all rates and charges in connection therewith and to collect all monies due
thereon.
(C) Disputes:
1. Provided, however, the foregoing notwithstanding, if any occupant, user or owner of the premises receiving service has a bona fide dispute over the
statement, charge or penaltydetermined or issued by the village, and challenges same as hereinafter provided, then services shall not be
disconnected until the occupant, user or owner raising said dispute shall have a reasonable opportunity to be heard by the assistant village manager,
an employee of the village hereby designated to conduct a predetermination review of the disputed statement, charge or penalty subsequent to
notice to the occupant, user or owner indicating to him the amount due the village, the nature of said statement, charge or penalty and notice that his
water service will be terminated in the event that said statement, charge or penalty is not paid or adjusted after having said dispute considered by
said assistant village manager.
2. In any final notice or notice of disconnection to occupant, user or owner prior to termination of service, the occupant, user or owner shall be notified
that if he, she or it has a bona fide dispute, said person shall have ten (10) days within which to request, in writing to the village clerk, a hearing by
the assistant village manager. If no request is made, the statement shall become final and service may be thereafter terminated by the village.
3. In the event that an informal hearing is held and the assistant village manager determines that the objection to the statement, charge or penalty is
not proper and that the statement, charge or penalty is correct, and in the event that the occupant, user or owner wishes to have reviewed any
decision of the assistant village manager with respect to statement, charge or penalty, the amount due or any reduction or increase in the amount
due, then he shall have the right to appeal to the village board of trustees for their determination and review of the decision of the assistant village
manager. Any decision of the assistant village manager not appealed from within the time hereinafter set forth shall be final.
4. Any request for review of the assistant village manager's decision must be made in writing, addressed to the village president and board of trustees
and must be made within ten (10) days after any adverse decision of the assistant village manager and by filing same with the village clerk, who shall
place the matter on the agenda of the next regularly scheduled meeting of the corporate authorities, whereat said matter shall be considered. At said
hearing the assistant village manager shall present his reasons for his decision. The occupant, user or owner shall also be heard as to his objection
to any statement, charge or penalty and the president and board of trustees shall then make its decision and the village clerk shall cause it to be
delivered to the occupant, user or owner within five (5) days, by personal service or certified mail. In the event that decision upholds any
disconnection, said disconnection shall take place not less than ten (10) days thereafter unless said termination is stayed by order of a court of
competent jurisdiction. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-6-9: CONTROL MANHOLE, BUILDING DRAIN, AND COST TO INSTALL:
(A) Control Manhole:
1. The owner of any nonresidential building in any zoning classification discharging other than normal residential domestic sanitary sewer waste shall
be required to construct, install and maintain a control manhole as set forth below. As used herein, the term "new nonresidential building" shall mean
a structure, or addition to a structure which requires a building permit prior to construction for any building thereon.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 313/460
2. Said control manhole shall be used for the purpose of inspecting and sampling of sanitary sewer wastes and for the measurement of the sanitary
sewage flow. Continuous sampling and recording flow measurement and equipment shall be provided when required by the village.
3. The control manhole shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with plans approved by the village engineer.
4. The control manhole shall meet the village's standard detail1 and shall be precast reinforced concrete with an inside diameter of four feet (4') for
service lines ten inches (10") and smaller and five feet (5') in inside diameter for service lines twelve inches (12") and above unless a larger diameter
or larger size is deemed necessary by the village engineer in order to facilitate access to and installation of flow measurement sampling and
recording equipment.
(B) Cost Of Installation: All costs and expenses incidental to the installation, connection, and operation of the building drain to the sewer main, including
manholes, control manholes, and necessary sampling and flow measurement and recording equipment when required, shall be borne by the owner of
the property. The owner shall indemnify the village for any loss or damage that may be directly or indirectly occasioned by the installation of the building
sewer.
(C) Location Of Control Manhole: The control manhole shall be located on public property or if approved by the village manager and village engineer on
private property for which an easement has been provided so as to allow the village and its employees and authorized representatives ready access at
all reasonable times to the premises, places or buildings where sanitary sewer service is supplied for the purpose of examining and testing the
operation of building drain and sewage flow, including all manholes, control manholes and necessary equipment and appurtenances thereof. It shall be
unlawful for any person to interfere with, prevent of obstruct said village or its duly authorized employees or representatives in performing their duties
hereunder. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-6-10: INSPECTION:
The plumbing inspector shall be notified by the person making the connection to the public sewer line when the work is begun and when it is ready for
inspection. All such work shall be left uncovered and convenient for examination until inspected and approved. The plumbing inspector shall examine the
work within one day after receipt of notice that the work is ready for inspection. All defective materials and work must be replaced and corrected. Upon
satisfactory completion of the work, the plumbing inspector shall issue a letter of certificate of approval. The plumbing inspector shall be notified twenty
four (24) hours in advance by the person making the connection. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-6-11: RIGHTS OF ACCESS:
(A) The village and its employees shall have ready access, to the extent allowed by law, to the premises, places or buildings where sewer service is
supplied for the purpose of examining and testing the operation of the sewerage system, or any part thereof, and for the purpose of determining if any
violation of the provisions of this chapter exists. Every user of said sewer shall take the same upon the conditions prescribed in this section.
(B) The failure to allow such access shall be grounds for the termination of water and sewer service, after notice and opportunity to be heard. In the event
of a notice of termination to occupant, user or owner, prior to termination of service, the occupant, user or owner shall have ten (10) days within which
to request, in writing to the village clerk, a hearing by the village manager or his designee. If no such request is made, water and sewer service may be
immediately terminated by the village.
(C) In the event that the occupant, user or owner wishes to have reviewed any decision of the village manager or his designee with respect to termination
of service, then he shall have the right to appeal to the village board of trustees for its determination and review of the decision of the village manager
or his designee. Any decision not appealed from within the time hereinafter set forth shall be final.
(D) Any request for review of an adverse decision must be made in writing, addressed to the village president and board of trustees and must be made
within ten (10) days after the decision and by filing same with the village clerk, who shall place the matter on the agenda of the next regularly scheduled
meeting of the corporate authorities, whereas said matter shall be considered. At said hearing the village manager or his designee shall present his
reasons for his decision. The occupant, user or owner shall also be heard. The president and board of trustees shall then make its decision and the
village clerk shall cause it to be delivered to the occupant, user or owner within five (5) days, by personal service or certified mail. In the event that the
decision upholds any termination, said termination shall takeplace not less than ten (10) days thereafter. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-6-12: SPECIFICATIONS FOR CONNECTIONS:
All building drains to serve structures to be connected to the sewer system of the village shall be constructed in accordance with the village standard
details2 and the following specifications. Where there is no specification, the "Standard Specifications For Water And Sewer Main Construction In Illinois",
shall be used.
(A) Materials:
1. All sanitary sewer collector mains to be owned and maintained by the village shall be SDR-21 PVC pipe meeting ASTM D-2241, or class 52 cement
lined ductile iron pipe with polywrap. Sanitary sewer service pipe from the village main to the property line shall be SDR-21 PVC pipe meeting ASTM
D-2241.
2. All building drain sewer lines from five feet (5') outside the building to the property line shall be constructed of either class 52 ductile iron pipe ASA
specification A21.51 with push on joints AWWA C-111, with polywrap or SDR26 PVC pipe meeting ASTM D-2241. No house sewer shall be less than
four inches (4") in diameter, unless otherwise authorized in writing by the village engineer and/or the community development director.
3. All building drain sewer lines from five feet (5') outside the building into the building shall be constructed of a minimum six inch (6") diameter service
weight cast iron pipe when the service enters the building below the foundation and footing. When the sewer service pipe enters the building above
the footing and through the foundation, a minimum six inch (6") diameter schedule 40 PVC pipe may be used.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 314/460
4. No building sewer for a commercial building shall be less than six inches (6") in diameter. Whenever a building sewer is within fifty feet (50') of an
existing well, the SDR 18 PVC pipe meeting ASTM D-2241, or class 52 ductile iron pipe must be used for the building sewers. Joints and
connections shall be gastight and watertight and shall be installed as follows:
(B) Laying Pipe: Unless otherwise authorized, all building sewers shall have a grade of not less than one-eighth inch (1/8") per foot. A grade of one-fourth
inch (1/4") per foot shall be used wherever practical. Pipe laying will be permitted only in dry trenches with stable bottoms.
(C) Excavations And Backfilling: All excavations shall be open trench work unless otherwise authorized or required by the community development
director. Backfilling shall not be doneuntil final inspection is made by the community development director.
1. The foundation in the trench shall be formed to prevent any subsequent settlement of the pipeline.
2. If the materials encountered at the trench bottom are unsuitable for pipe bedding, such materials shall be removed and this trench bottom brought
back to four inches (4") below grade with selected crushed stone material, or a concrete cradle, placed as necessary to provide adequate bedding
for the pipe.
3. The trench shall be excavated to four inches (4") below grade and brought back to the proper grade with crushed stone compacted so as to provide
a firm foundation and uniform support for the house sewer line. The crushed stone bedding shall be carried up to the centerline of the pipe for the full
width of the trench and thoroughly compacted in place. For PVC pipe, crushed stone shall be placed around the entire pipe, and four inches (4") over
the pipe.
4. Backfilling from the centerline of the pipe to the ground surface shall be placed in layers and solidly tamped or packed up to the original surface of
the ground, except that crushed stone fill shall be used under all sidewalks, driveways and paved streets.
5. All excavation shall be adequately guarded per village requirements or the FHWA "Manual On Uniform Traffic Control Devices" standards with
barricades and lights so as to protect the public from hazard. Streets, sidewalks, parkways and other public property disturbed in the course of the
work shall be restored in a manner satisfactory to the village prior to the release of any cash bonds or other guarantees.
(D) Connections: The connection of the building sewer to the sewer main shall be made at the connection designated for that property, and if no properly
located connection point is available, the owner shall install a connection in the sewer main at his expense, and of a location, type and method as
specified by the village engineer or community development director.
(E) Rainwater Leads: Roof leaders, surface drains and ground water drains shall not be connected to the sanitary sewers. The possible presence of such
connections shall constitute grounds for inspection of premises, places or buildings where sewer service is supplied, as provided in section 7-6-10 of
this chapter.
(F) Service Station Drains: Automobile service station floor drains shall be equipped with interceptors which shall prevent the discharge into the drainage
system of mud, sand, gasoline, oil and other materials likely to clog the drainage system. Such interceptors shall be maintained by the owner at his
own expense, in continuously efficient operation.
(G) Various Tests For Sanitary Sewers: All sanitary sewers hereafter constructed within the village in any subdivision excepting single-family residential
service connection, shall be subject to infiltration or exfiltration tests and televising at the owner's expense to meet the requirements of the village
engineer or community development director. The owners shall also pay the expense of a representative of the village witnessing said tests. (Ord. 95-
2684, 9-5-1995)
7-6-13: REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE:
(A) All repairs and maintenance of building drains, from the building to the village right of way, including manholes, control manholes and flow and
sampling equipment, shall be made by and at the expense of the owners of the property served. The village may, in case of emergency, repair any
building drain including said appurtenances noted, and, if this is done, the cost of such repair work shall be repaid to the village by the owners of the
property served.
(B) If the charges incurred in performing such repair work are not paid within thirty (30) days after rendition of the bill for such service, such charges shall
be deemed and are hereby declared to be delinquent and thereafter such delinquency shall constitute a lien upon the real estate for which such service
is supplied, and the village finance director is hereby authorized and directed to file sworn statements showing such delinquencies in the office of the
recorder of deeds of DuPage County, Illinois, and the filing of such statements shall be deemed notice of the lien of such charges for such service.
(Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-6-14: GREASE TRAP/TRIPLE BASIN MAINTENANCE:
All grease, oil and sand traps required by this code shall be regularly cleaned and maintained by and at the expense of the owners of the property served.
Such grease, oil and sand traps shall be cleaned whenever they are full to more than three-fourths (3/4) of their capacity. Additionally, special cleaning may
be ordered by the public works director in the event that inadequate maintenance of grease traps is causing problems to the village sanitary sewer system.
Failure to maintain a grease, oil, or sand trap in accordance with this code shall be considered a nuisance and a violation of this code subject to the
special repair provisions of section 7-6-13 of this chapter and subject to the violations and penalties set forth in section 7-6-15 of this chapter. (Ord. 95-
2684, 9-5-1995)
7-6-15: VIOLATIONS; PENALTIES:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 315/460
(A) Any person who shall not obtain the permit required by this chapter prior to the commencement of any work requiring such permit shall be fined, upon
conviction thereof, as established inthe annual fee ordinance for each offense.
(B) Any person who shall refuse or neglect to obey any order to correct or remove a nuisance existing by reason of connections made to the sewer main
and sewer lines laid in violation of this chapter shall be fined, upon conviction of such offense, as established by the annual fee ordinance for each
offense. A separate offense shall be deemed committed upon each day that such nuisance shall continue to exist after the expiration of the time fixed
for the removal or correction thereof.
(C) Each person who shall violate any other provisions of this chapter shall be fined, upon conviction thereof, as established by the annual fee ordinance
for each time that he shall so violate such provision. (Ord. 96-2776, 5-20-1996)
Chapter 7
STORM AND SANITARY SEWERS; WATER MAIN CONSTRUCTION; VILLAGE
STANDARD DETAILS
7-7-0: ASSIGNMENT OF RESPONSIBILITY:
Wherever the term public works director, village manager, community development director or business office manager appears, it includes his or her
designee. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1: STORM SEWERS AND DRAINS:
7-7-1-1: PERMIT REQUIRED:
(A) Whenever a subdivision, lot or parcel of land is to be improved or developed, the owner shall provide storm water sewers to serve adequately the area
being platted or developed and shall secure a permit from the village's community development director for the work.
(B) Before any work is commenced or a permit is obtained for said work, the owner shall submit to the village three (3) sets of plans and specifications
prepared by a registered engineer for approval. When said plans are approved and before a permit is issued, the owner shall provide the village with
six (6) additional sets of plans and specifications with revisions required, if any. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
(C) Prior to commencement of any work hereunder or issuance of any permit a letter of credit shall be posted with the village in compliance with section 5-
18-6 of this code. (Ord. 2000-3200, 2-21-2000)
7-7-1-2: FEES:
(A) Permit Fee: For each application for permit for construction of storm sewers, drainage ditches or channels, and culverts or bridges, the fee shall be as
established by the annual fee ordinance.
(B) Inspection Fee; Reimbursement Of Village Expenses:
1. The community development director shall make or cause to be made such inspections as may be necessary to ensure compliance with the
provisions of this section 7-7-1. Such inspections shall include, but not be limited to, on site inspections by the community development director at all
times during the construction, installation or testing of said improvements. The village shall be reimbursed for expenses, as established by the annual
fee ordinance, resulting from such inspections, observation or other services rendered by the community development director during the
construction, installation or testing of said improvements.
2. The owner or developer shall reimburse the village for engineering fees and testing and inspection expenses, as established by the annual fee
ordinance, incurred by the village relating to the improvements covered by this section within thirty (30) days of receipt of an invoice for same.
Further, owner shall reimburse the village for costs, as established by the annual fee ordinance, of maintenance, replacement and repair (except
cleaning) of storm sewers and related improvements, including the removal of landscaping, paving or other obstacles and returning the area to its
condition prior to excavation.Connection may be refused or service discontinued if timely reimbursement is not made pursuant to this section1. (Ord.
95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-3: GUARANTEE; CERTIFICATE OF INSURANCE:
(A) Guarantee: Before a permit is issued, the owner shall provide the village with a certified check or cashier's check, negotiable securities, letter of credit,
or a surety bond, payable to the village treasurer in an amount as established by the annual fee ordinance, in relation to the cost of improvements as
estimated by the owner and approved by the village engineer, to assure the satisfactory installation of said improvements as outlined and contained in
the approved plans and specifications. If the owner posts a surety bond, it shall have good and sufficient surety thereon, and be approved by the village
attorney. Until official acceptance of the work, the owner shall be responsible for all maintenance of all required improvements.
(B) Certificate Of Insurance: Any person performing work under this section shall take out and maintain during the construction of the project such
commercial general liability insurance in an amount established by the annual fee ordinance combined single limit per occurrence for bodily injury,
personal injury, and property damage and an amount as established by the annual fee ordinance aggregate as shall protect him, the village and the
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 316/460
village's representatives from claims from liability and property damage which may arise from construction of this project. The village shall be furnished
certificates of insurance issued by the companies carrying the risk, which said certificates shall be in form and substance satisfactory to and approved
by the village. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-4: REQUIREMENTS:
The design of the drainage system shall anticipate and provide capacity for other drainage from naturally tributary areas on the basis of the ultimate
development of such other tributary area. The drainage system shall comply with, but shall not be limited to, the following:
(A) The recommendation of the division of waterways, state of Illinois, as per, but not limited to, house bill 532-G.
(B) The design of the drainage system shall consider and show:
1. The entire storm drainage area of which the subdivision lot, or parcel of land is a part.
2. Storm sewer capacities shall be determined with the use of the rational formula Q = CIA as set forth in drainage manual of theIllinois department of
transportation as may be amended from time to time, and shall be designed for a 10-year storm frequency. A minimum "c" coefficient of 0.35 shall be
used for all undeveloped land in the drainage area. Where land has a zoning area greater than residential, "c" coefficient suitable for such anticipated
development shall be used. The village engineer shall be furnished with design calculations of storm drainage required.
3. A system of sewers or pipelines sufficient in size to eliminate flooding or ponding of water.
4. All existing watercourses, storm sewers and culverts.
(C) All storm sewers are required to meet the following minimum requirements:
1. The sewers shall not be less than twelve inches (12") inside diameter, unless approved in writing by the village engineer. The storm sewers shall be
reinforced concrete pipe or PVC pipe (SDR21) meeting ASTM D-2241 and meeting the most recent Illinois department of transportation
specifications.
2. The sewers shall be designed in such a way as to ensure a minimum velocity flow of two feet (2') per second, and a maximum velocity flow of eight
feet (8') per second.
3. Manholes shall be provided at all changes in direction of pipe and pipe size. Catch basins shall be located not more than three hundred feet (300')
apart unless otherwise approved by the village engineer. All manholes, catch basins and pipe shall be of the type and material and constructed in
accordance with the village's standard details and requirements, as amended from time to time2.
(D) In any subdivision lot or parcel of land where it is determined by the village engineer that the main outlet sewer would be larger than ninety six inches
(96"), then a ditch or drainage channel meeting the following standards may be used if the village board so approves:
1. With grades to four percent (4%), ditch may have earth bottoms and sod banks.
2. With grades greater than four percent (4%), ditches must be paved.
3. All ditches shall have side slopes of not less than three to one (3:1).
4. Easements for all ditches shall be dedicated to the village, and there shall be provided, in addition to the necessary width required for the ditch, a
strip of land on each side of the ditch of a width of fifteen feet (15'), said distance to be measuredperpendicular to trees, poles, structures and other
obstructions. The slope of these side areas to the ditch shall not exceed five percent (5%). There shall be no trees, bushes, or obstructions of any
kind placed in this area.
5. Culverts or bridges shall be provided at all street crossings and shall be sized to eliminate flooding or ponding of water and shall have a minimum
cover of twelve inches (12"). Culverts or bridges shall be reinforced concrete or precast reinforced concrete pipes with necessary headwalls. Culverts
or bridges shall extend a minimum of five feet (5') past each right of way line of the street and shall extend far enough to provide a minimum slope of
three to one (3:1) from the right of way line down to the invert of the pipe.
6. All ditches, bridges and culverts shall be located and designed in accordance with the village's standards as amended from time to time and
requirements of the village engineer.
7. All culverts or bridges shall be provided with suitable railings and/or guardrails as required and approved by the village. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-5: OVERSIZE DESIGN:
The owner of the subdivision lot or parcel of land shall provide storm water sewers of adequate size to not only drain the property in question, but shall
provide storm sewers, bridges or culverts of sufficient size to adequately drain the entire drainage area draining to and through the property. There shall be
no compensation to the owner by the village for the increased pipe sizes required, if any. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-6: RULES AND REGULATIONS:
Storm drainage systems or structures shall be installed to comply with this chapter, and the rules, regulations, specifications and standard details of the
village, as amended from time to time. All plans submitted for approval shall comply with all of the above. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-7: TRENCHING:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 317/460
All trenching done under existing streets, alleys, walks or drives shall be backfilled and the surface repaired in accordance with the village's standard
details and requirements, as amended from time to time. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-8: RAINWATER DRAINS:
It shall be unlawful to construct or permit the maintenance of any rainwater drain which discharges onto any sidewalk and itshall be unlawful to construct or
permit the maintenance of any such drain which discharges onto any public street or alley. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-9: CONNECTION OF SANITARY WASTES TO STORM SEWERS OR WATERCOURSES:
It shall be unlawful to discharge any sanitary sewage into the storm sewer drainage system of the village or into any tributary storm sewer drainage system
connecting to the village system or into any river or any watercourse within the jurisdiction of the village3. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-10: APPROVAL REQUIRED:
(A) All work required to be done under this chapter by an applicant, be he the owner, subdivider or contractor, shall be done only in the presence of the
community development director.
(B) The community development director shall inspect all work to see that the same has been completed in accordance with the approved plans and
specifications. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-11: EXISTING DRAINAGE NUISANCES:
Any surface, storm water sump pump or roof drainage which creates a structural, safety or health hazard, or any other nuisance to the owners or
occupants of adjacent premises or to the public by reason of discharge into, onto or across any adjacent building, premises or public thoroughfare shall be
abated by the owners of the improperly drained area; and the community development director shall require the drainage to be disposed of in an
appropriate manner. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-12: REVOCATION OF PERMIT:
The appointed official of the village or the enforcement officer, under his direction, are hereby authorized and empowered to revoke a permit issued
pursuant to this section 7-7-1 when it has been determined that the permittee has violated the conditions or provisions of such permit or of this section 7-7-
1. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-1-13: VIOLATIONS; PENALTIES:
(A) Violation Declared Public Nuisance: Any violation of any terms and provisions of this section 7-7-1 is hereby declared by the president and board of
trustees to be a public nuisance.(Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
(B) Fines And Penalties:
1. Any person violating or failing to comply with any terms or provisions of this section 7-7-1 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction thereof
shall be subject to a fine as established by the annual fee ordinance for the first offense; and for each subsequent offense shall be subject to a fine
as established by the annual fee ordinance to be recovered in any court of competent jurisdiction. A separate offense shall be deemed committed for
each and every day that any person shall violate or fail to comply with any of the terms and provisions of this section 7-7-1.
2. The prosecuting attorney for the village is hereby authorized and empowered to institute and prosecute any and all proceedings, suits and actions
necessary to collect any and all fines and penalties herein provided for and is also hereby authorized and empowered to institute and prosecute any
and all suits at law or in equity as may be appropriate or necessary to prevent unlawful connections to the village system or systems tributary thereto
in violation of the provisions of this section 7-7-1. (Ord. 96-2776, 5-20-1996)
7-7-2: SANITARY SEWER MAIN CONSTRUCTION:
7-7-2-1: PERMIT REQUIRED:
(A) It shall be unlawful to connect to and extend any main or lateral sanitary sewer line of the village sanitary sewer system or construct a separate
sanitary sewer system and treatment plant without having first secured a permit or approval therefor from the community development director.
(B) All persons desiring to extend the sewage systems of the village or construct a sewage system in the village must make application or request for such
service. Such applications or requests shall be accompanied by three (3) sets of plans and specifications prepared by a registered engineer for
approval. When said plans are approved and before a permit or approval is issued, the applicant shall provide the village with six (6) additional sets of
plans and specifications with revisions required, if any. Before construction is commenced on the project, the applicant shall furnish to the village a
copy of the permit obtained from the state environmental protection agency for the work.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 318/460
(C) Applications for permits shall be accompanied by a statement as to the purpose, the type of premises and number of people to be served. (Ord. 95-
2684, 9-5-1995)
(D) Prior to commencement of any work hereunder or issuance of any permit a letter of credit shall be posted with the village incompliance with section 5-
18-6 of this code. (Ord. 2000-3200, 2-21-2000)
7-7-2-2: FEES; REIMBURSEMENT OF VILLAGE EXPENSES:
(A) For each application for permit for construction of sanitary sewers, the fee shall be as established by the annual fee ordinance. The community
development director shall make or cause to be made such inspections as may be necessary to ensure compliance with the provisions of this section.
Such inspections shall include, but not be limited to, on site inspections by the community development director at all times during the construction,
installation or testing of said sewers.
(B) The owner or developer shall reimburse the village of engineering fees and testing and inspection expenses, as established by the annual fee
ordinance, incurred by the village relating to the improvements covered by this section within thirty (30) days of receipt of an invoice for same. Further,
owner shall reimburse the village of all costs of maintenance, replacement and repair (except cleaning) of sanitary sewers and related improvements,

or service discontinued if timely reimbursement is not made pursuant to this section. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-3: GUARANTEE; CERTIFICATE OF INSURANCE:
(A) Guarantee: The owner shall provide the village with a certified check or cashier's check, negotiable securities, letter of credit or a surety bond, payable
to the treasurer of the village in an amount as established by the annual fee ordinance, in relation to the cost of the improvement as established by the
owner and approved by the village engineer to assure the satisfactory installation of said improvements as outlined and contained in the approved
plans and specifications. Until official acceptance of the work, the owner shall be responsible for all maintenance of all required improvements.
(B) Certificate Of Insurance: Any person performing work under this section shall take out and maintain during the construction of the property, commercial
general liability insurance in an amount as established by the annual fee ordinance combined single limit per occurrence for bodily injury, personal
injury, and property damage, an amount as established by the annual fee ordinance aggregate which shall name him, the village and the village's
representative as additional insured and insure them against liability and property damages which may arise from construction of this project. The
village shall be furnished certificates of insurance issued by the companies carrying the risk, which said certificates shall be in form and substance
satisfactory to and approved by the village. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-4: RULES AND REGULATIONS:
Sanitary sewers shall be installed in compliance with the rules and regulations, specifications and standard details of the village as amended from time to
time, and in accordance with the rules and regulations of the county of DuPage department of environmental concerns, state of Illinois environmental
protection agency and the "Standard Specifications For Water And Sewer Main Construction In Illinois". All plans submitted for approval shall comply with
all of the above. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-5: REQUIREMENTS:
(A) Trenching: All trenching done under existing streets, alleys, walks and drives shall be backfilled with an approved aggregate trench backfill and the
surface repaired in accordance with the village's standard details and requirements, as amended from time to time.
(B) Watertightness And Imperfections Of Work:
1. Sanitary sewer lines, including branch connections and riser pipe, shall be constructed as nearly watertight as practicable, and after completed with
backfilling in place, infiltration of ground water into any section of the sewer system shall not exceed two hundred (200) gallons per day per mile of
sewer per inch of diameter. Upon completion of installation of sewers, the owner, subdivider or contractor shall perform infiltration, exfiltration or air
tests, as may be required by the community development director, and under the supervision of said community development director to demonstrate
the acceptability of the infiltration in said sewer. Upon completion, there shall be no visible leakage into the sewer at any place.
2. Manholes, chambers and sewer structures shall be watertight upon completion of the work as shall all connections thereto.
3. Inverted siphons and other pressure pipelines shall show no leakage when filled with water under a pressure of not less than ten (10) times the
maximum working pressure to which the line will be subjected during normal use, but not to exceed one hundred twenty five (125) pounds per
square inch.
4. Upon completion of the sewer and in addition to the community development director inspection from and between connected manholes and
structures, the owner, subdivider or contractor shall provide adequate inspection by closed circuit television as may be required by the village
engineer4.
5. The owner, subdivider or contractor shall furnish and provideat his expense, all necessary tools, equipment, ventilation, apparatus, closed circuit
television, measuring devices, testing machines, personnel and labor required by the village engineer for the purpose of testing and inspecting sewer
lines and structures.
6. Sewers that have been televised that show excessive infiltration, settlement, faulty grade or alignment breakage or other unacceptable construction
shall, after being repaired or corrected of said defects, be retelevised at the owner's expense in order that the village engineer may determine that
defects have been properly corrected.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 319/460
7. Exfiltration or air tests when required shall not exceed the maximum infiltration rates provided for elsewhere in this section.
8. Should a test show excessive leakage, the owner, subdivider or contractor shall make necessary corrections in the section tested, and shall take all
steps to ensure completed sewer lines with infiltration rates within the maximum allowable as specified and as outlined under this section. (Ord. 95-
2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-6: CONSTRUCTION BY VILLAGE OR BY OWNER:
(A) Sewers Constructed By Owner Or Subdivider: Any main or lateral sewer which is laid at the expense of an owner or subdivider shall extend from the
main sewer for the entire width of the lot to be served.
(B) Sewers Constructed By The Village: Any main or lateral sewer which is laid at the expense of the village shall extend from the main sewer for the
entire width of the lot to be serviced and prior to any connection thereto, the village is to be reimbursed for the cost of the sewer at a front footage fee
as stipulated by village ordinances. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-7: OVERSIZE DESIGN:
Where required by the village to conform with overall planning of future connections any sewer is required larger than necessary to serve the immediate
property adequately, the owner shall construct such oversized sewers. No pipe less than eight inches (8") in diameter shall be laid by the owner or
subdivider. No bids shall be taken or work commenced until such agreement is arrived at in writing with the village. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-8: STORM WATER PROHIBITED:
No customer or owner or occupant of premises receiving sewer service shall discharge, cause to be discharged, allow to be discharged or permit to be
discharged any storm water, surface water, roof runoff, surface drainage, ground water drainage,footing drainage, window well drainage, driveway
drainage, garage floor drainage, patio drainage, downspout drainage, crawl space drainage, nonsanitary basement floor drainage, nonsanitary sump
pump drainage, cooling water, unapproved industrial process water, or any other nonsanitary sewage drainage into the sanitary sewer or into the building
sewer service connection so as to reach said sanitary sewer; no customer or owner or occupant of premises receiving sewer service shall connect, cause
to be connected, allow to be connected or remain connected or permit to be connected or remain connected, and no premises receiving sewer service
shall have connected, any sump pump or other pumping device for draining window wells, footings, patios, garages, driveways, downspouts, crawl spaces
or other nonsanitary drainage areas, or any footing, window well, driveway, patio, garage, downspout or other nonsanitary sewage drain to the sanitary
sewer or to any building sanitary sewer service line which connects to said sanitary sewer. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-9: SEWER SYSTEM AVAILABLE:
A sanitary sewer system shall be deemed available to premises used for human occupancy, if such premises are within two hundred feet (200') of a public
sewer. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-2-10: APPROVAL REQUIRED:
(A) All work required to be done under this section 7-7-2 by an applicant, be he the owner, subdivider or contractor, shall be done only in the presence of
the community development director.
(B) The community development director shall inspect all work to see that same has been completed in accordance with the approved plans and
specifications. Such inspection shall include witnessing an infiltration test, exfiltration test or television inspection as required by this section 7-7-2. The
owner, subdivider or contractor shall conduct and pay for said tests and sewers shall meet all test requirements before being approved. (Ord. 95-2684,
9-5-1995)

2684, 9-5-1995)

7-7-3: WATER MAIN CONSTRUCTION:
7-7-3-1: PERMIT REQUIRED:
(A) It shall be unlawful to connect to and extend any water main of the village water supply system or construct a separate water supply system without
having first secured a permit and approval therefor from the corporate authorities as well as the Illinois environmental protection agency.
(B) All persons desiring to extend the water supply system of the village or construct a separate water supply system in the village must make application
or request for such service. Such applications or requests shall be accompanied by three (3) sets of plans and specifications prepared by a registered
engineer for approval. When said plans are approved and before a permit or approval is issued, the applicant shall provide the village with six (6)
additional sets of plans and specifications with revisions required, if any. Before construction is commenced on the project, the applicant shall furnish to
the village a copy of the permits obtained from the state. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
(C) Prior to commencement of any work hereunder or issuance of any permit a letter of credit shall be posted with the village in compliance with section 5-
18-6 of this code. (Ord. 2000-3200, 2-21-2000)
7-7-3-2: FEES; REIMBURSEMENT OF VILLAGE EXPENSES:
(A) For each application for construction of any water mains, the fee shall be as established by the annual fee ordinance. The community development
director shall make or cause to be made such inspections as may be necessary to ensure compliance with the provisions of this section. Such
inspections shall include, but not be limited to, on site inspections by the community development director at all times during construction, installation or
testing of said water mains.
(B) The owner or developer shall reimburse the village for all engineering fees and testing and inspection expenses, as established by the annual fee
ordinance, incurred by the village relating to the improvements covered by this section within thirty (30) days of receipt of an invoice for same. Further,
owner shall reimburse the village for costs, as established by the annual fee ordinance, of maintenance, replacement and repair (except cleaning) of
water mains and related improvements, including the removal of landscaping, paving or other obstacles and returning the area to its condition prior to
excavation. Connection may be refused or service discontinued if timely reimbursement is not made pursuant to this section. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-3-3: CERTIFICATE OF INSURANCE AND GUARANTEE:
(A) Insurance: Any person performing work under this section shall take out and maintain, during the construction of the improvement, commercial general
liability insurance in an amount as established by the annual fee ordinance combined single limit per occurrence for bodily injury, personal injury and

as additional insured and insure them against liability for bodily injury and property damages which may arise from construction of this project. The

(B) Guarantee: The owner shall provide the village with a certified check or cashier's check, negotiable securities, letter of credit, or a surety bond, payable

7-7-3-4: RULES AND REGULATIONS:
Water supply systems shall be installed to comply with the rules and regulations, specifications and standard details of the village, as amended from time
to time, and in accordance with the rules and regulations of the state of Illinois current "Standard Specifications For Water And Sewer Main Construction In
Illinois", and shall also be in compliance with the following:
(A) Trenching: All trenching done under and in existing streets, alleys, walks and drives shall be backfilled with an aggregate trench backfill and the
surface repaired in accordance with the village's standard details and requirements currently in effect and as amended from time to time.
(B) Construction Of Water Mains:
1. Water Mains Constructed By Owner Or Subdivider: Any water main which is constructed at the expense of an owner or subdivider shall extend from
the existing main across the entire width of the lot or lots to be served and shall be provided with necessary valves, fittings and hydrants as set forth
in national board of fire underwriters current handbook "Standard Grading Schedule_Water Supply" and as required by the village engineer. No
water main of less than six inches (6") in size shall be constructed.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=339 321/460
2. Water Mains Constructed By Village: Any water main which is constructed at the expense of the village shall extend from existing main across the
entire width of the lot or lots to be served and prior to any connection thereto, the village shall be reimbursed for the cost of the laying of the main at
the rate as established by the annual fee ordinance per front foot of property. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-3-5: OVERSIZE DESIGN:
In the event that the village determines it is necessary due to overall planning for future connections that any water main be constructed larger than
necessary to serve the immediate property adequately, the owner or subdivider shall construct such oversized main at his expense. No pipe less than six
inches (6") shall be laid by an owner or subdivider. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-3-6: APPROVAL REQUIRED:
All work required to be done under this section by an applicant, be he the owner, subdivider or contractor, shall be inspected by the community
development director from time to time as required, and as the work progresses. Before final approval can be obtained, the community development
director shall inspect all work and see that same has been completed in accordance with the approved plans and specifications. Such inspection shall
include, but not be limited to, pressure testing and sterilization of mains all as set forth in "Standard Specifications For Water And Sewer Main Construction
Of The State Of Illinois" and as requiredby the village engineer. The owner, subdivider or contractor shall conduct and pay for said tests and shall meet all
test requirements before being approved. The owner, subdivider or contractor shall furnish to the village Mylar and three (3) full sets of as built drawings
for the improvements constructed. Said drawings shall be furnished before final acceptance. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-3-7: REVOCATION OF PERMIT:
The village manager or the community development director is hereby authorized and empowered to revoke a permit issued pursuant to this section 7-7-3
when it has been determined that the permittee has violated the conditions of such permit or of this section 7-7-3. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-3-8: VIOLATIONS; PENALTIES:
(A) Violation Declared Nuisance: Any violation of any terms and provisions of this section 7-7-3 is hereby declared by the president and board of trustees
to be a public nuisance. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
(B) Fines And Penalties:
1. Any person violating or failing to comply with any of the terms or provisions of this section 7-7-3 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction
thereof shall be subject to a fine as established by the annual fee ordinance for each offense, to be recovered in any court of competent jurisdiction.
2. A separate offense shall be deemed committed for each and every day that any person violates or fails to comply with any of the terms or provisions
of this section 7-7-3.
3. The village attorney is hereby authorized and empowered to institute and prosecute any and all proceedings, suits and actions necessary to collect
any and all fines and penalties herein provided for, and is also hereby authorized and empowered to institute and prosecute any and all suits at law
or in equity as may be appropriate or necessary to prevent unlawful connections to the village water system in violation of the provisions of this
section 7-7-3. (Ord. 96-2776, 5-20-1996)
7-7-4: AS BUILT DRAWINGS:
The owner of any developed property shall provide the village with three (3) sets of as built plans of all site improvements, plus one set of as built Mylars.
These shall be provided prior to acceptance of any improvements. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995)
7-7-5: SCHEDULE OF STANDARD DETAILS:
The standards and details referred to in this chapter, and elsewhere in this code, covering the plans and specifications for construction, improvement
and/or repair or replacement of various public properties and ways, specifically: sanitary sewers, water mains, storm sewers, streets, streets and curbing
and street openings are as hereinafter set out in full. (Ord. 95-2684, 9-5-1995) PAVEMENT STANDARDS - DETAIL NO. 1
